IX.iii.1.B.1.
i
.
Additional Social Security Benefits
An individual receiving Social Security disability, retirement, or survivorâ€™s benefits usually receives additional benefits for
unmarried children under age 18 (or under age 19 if the child is a full-time high school student), and
unmarried children age 18 or over who
were severely disabled before age 22, and
continue to be disabled.
title: M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section B - Social Security Administration (SSA) Benefits Program
citation: Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section B
